column4: anyway, there's deborphan debfoster when I really want to remove packages I don't use on my system

both available from apt; apt-cache show <package> is very good for descriptions (better than me) =)
k Ill check them out
basically used to find orphaned libraries and/or to weed out unused/unwanted packages
not really. installation_sources -a URL
I just couldnt seem to get it . ubuntu's system just came more natural to me
Ubuntu lists all sources in one file though which is quite nice
my ubuntu box is going to be down for a month or so maybe more...will it be safe when I get it back online to just do a dist-upgrade ?
yes
with sudo apt-get update first of course
ok cool
edgy is fine to use; upgrading is dodgy though.
Dapper had its issues around too, but it's better stability-wise than edgy.
